revision.text:
[[File:Stan Hunt, cartoonist.gif|thumb|Hunt in 2004]] '''Stanley Richard Hunt''' (August 18, 1929 â€“ January 4, 2006) was an [[United States|American]] newspaper cartoonist.
Born in [[Williston Park, New York]], Hunt served in the [[Korean War]] with the [[U.S. 1st Infantry Division|1st Infantry Division]] of the [[United States Army|U.S. Army]]. After the war, Hunt attended the [[New York School of Art]]. He created cartoons for various newspapers, including the ''[[New York World-Telegram]]'' and ''[[St. Petersburg Times]]''. He was with ''[[The Pilot (Pilot Mountain, North Carolina)|The Pilot]]'' in [[North Carolina]] shortly before his death at age 76.
He was an editorial and sports cartoonist for ''The Springfield Union'' and ''[[The Charlotte Observer]]''. Later he moved on to [[Myrtle Beach, South Carolina]] to work on [[golf]] magazines.
==Awards== Hunt was nominated for the [[Pulitzer Prize]] for Cartooning.
==External links== *[http://www.answers.com/topic/stan-hunt Answers.com] *[http://www.afnews.info/public/afnews/viewnews.pl?newsid1136725443,18350,.htm AF News]
